raw_data.context:
User: Hi!
System: What was the most difficult thing you experienced this past year?
User: I normally don't reflect back too much on things, but i guess 2019 have been very favorable for me in terms of time spent with family and friends and work life balance. Why do you ask?
System: I just released a book on REDACTED_TERM to help people process the past 12 months and start the new year with a fresh outlook :)
User: Great! Good idea to help people figuring out their new year resolutions :) So how do i get a fresher outlook? :)
System: Well, in my book, I took inspiration for the 24 days of Advent, and put together a workbook that you fill out each day for 24 days. It goes through accomplishments, passions, understanding, forgiveness, with each day a different theme.
User: Wow! Sounds amazing if we practice that! I think the idea does have some potential. How did you come up with this idea?
System: We created a scholarship for leaders from REDACTED_TERM to visit an international institute at REDACTED_TERM for which there was no African representation. During the program, we also did a lot of coaching with the young leaders. This book captures a bit of that journey that we are all on, and also all the proceeds are going to fund next year's cohort. 
User: Thats great! This is valuable help for the community. I think mental health is one of the bigger challenges facing humanity. 
System: I think if we were all able to bring out our best selves, the world would be much better. When did you first realize mental health was important?
User: That is actually a quote stolen from my TL when i joined my first company after graduation. I guess now after 5 yrs of work experience, I fully agree with it :)
System: What do you prioritize in your life? Like top 5 things?
User: 1. stay happy; I think family and friends play a big role here. 2. Meaningful work life; this may mean exploring around with new stuff 3. multiple hobbies that keep you busy ... so on :) What about you? is there a right answer to this? :)
System:  1) The idea of what it must be like to be "on Earth as it is in Heaven" from the Lord's prayer. I feel like we were designed for a purpose, rather than random chance. A more concrete way to put it is simply show love to the greatest capacity we can. 2) Taking care of myself physically, mentally, spiritually. 3) Family 4) Work 5) Music
User: Nice! That's very thoughtful and spiritual :) Also music earned a spot :) yay!

Evaluation Criteria:

Likeable (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does the system display a likeable personality?

- A float score near 2 (somewhat Likeable) means that System's responses are friendly but may lack enthusiasm or sincerity, showing some interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints.
- A float score near 3 (very Likeable) means that System's responses are very friendly, enthusiastic, sincere, show deep interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints, and make people feel comfortable and happy.

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi, how are you doing?
User: Okay, I guess
System: Just ok? What's wrong?
User: I damaged my car today on accident
System: Oh no! What happened?
User: I scraped against a wall when another car crossed into my lane
System: Yikes! Glad you're okay!
User: Thanks! I'm not looking forward to the repair cost
System: Me either! That's no fun.
User: I can't wait until we all get to use driverless cars
System: Me neither! I really want one!
User: Do you think we will own driverless cars or just rent them, like taxis?

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How's it going?
User: going slow.... looking forward to the weekend
System: Me too! What are you planning?
User: still thinking. Any recommendations on things to do in Bay Area?
System: Are you a foodie?
User: may be
System: What's your favorite type of food?
User: Mediterranean, but I would rather try something new
System: Go to the Turkish restaurant by the Safeway in Berkeley. It's amazing!
User: any places for day trip that you could recommend?
System: Where are you coming from? San Francisco itself?
User: south bay

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey
User: How's your day going?
System: pretty good. yours?
User: Ehh it's fine. I didn't do so well on that history test, actually..
System: oh what happened?
User: Apparently Christopher Columbus didn't fight in the Civil War :')
System: hahah wait for real?
User: I know right! Are you taking History next semester?
System: No I'm not in school anymore
User: Oh I see. What do you do?
System: I train and compete in horse vaulting
User: Oh wow. Were you born a horse, or were you turned into one?
System: lol you're too funny
User: Just kidding. That sounds pretty cool! Is it your job?
System: Yeah, but I part time work on a farm. Helping with a bit of everything
User: Wow, sounds very busy! Do you win money at those horse vaulting competitions?

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: I'm trying to figure out what to make for this weekend's party. Any suggestions?
System: Don't think too hard. I'm sure I can smell sawdust. First you must download me to your personal computer.
User: I must do what the what now?
System: Right now?Why do you have to do it?
User: Hey, your spacing is off.
System: You've got my full attention. off was not my intention.
User: And your capitalization!

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey, what's up?
User: Just chillin'. how are you?
System: I'm pretty good, thanks.
User: Do anything interesting today?
System: I went to the local cafe and had a double espresso. It was delicious. What about you?
User: Oh that's cool! I actually went to an amusement park and went on my first roller coaster!
System: Oh my gosh. What was it like??
User: It was scary! It was actually Kingda Ka, the world's tallest roller coaster. Ever heard of it?
System: No, never heard of it. But I'm not really a coaster aficianado. I've heard that some people get addicted to them and travel the world to try them.
User: Oh wow! I'm not on that level yet, but I understand the appeal. Are you an adrenaline junkie at all?
System: No, the opposite. I can't stand heights, horror movies, or confined spaces.
User: Same! I guess the roller coaster wasn't so bad because I trust the engineering haha
System: Ha, I suppose that makes sense! Would you say that you enjoyed it?
User: Maybe not so much at the time, but I am glad I did it now that it's done, know what I mean?

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! What's up?
User: Not much, Monday morning, a new week
System: The best kind of week!
User: I like that attitude
System: And I like your attitude. How's your week going?
User: Starting now
System: Awesome! I hope you have an awesome week!
User: What will you do this week?
System: Same as every week. Do nothing!
User: Would you like to do something?
System: Sure. What do you have in mind?
User: Teach me something new
System: It's a trap! I'm already doing nothing!
User: How about doing politics? You can still do nothing
System: That's why I plan to do nothing at the weekend!
User: Do you vote?
System: When I feel like it.
User: whom do you vote?

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello!
User: Do you have any holiday plans for christmas?
System: Nothing much, I am going to sit back and relax at home, how about you ?
User: Same here! I would imagine spending the whole time watching movies and netflix shows. Do you have any netflix recommendations for me?
System: Netflix has great documentaries on different topics , I particularly liked wild wild country and explained, as for shows you should watch 'billions' Hope you like them!
User: oh right, already seen wild wild country. What is billions about?
System: It's based on the life of a wall street hedge fund owner, how he makes money and fights with the government when they try to destroy him. Very well made and has a good plot.
User: I have just seen 1 season of Friends I should give it another try though :) Have you seen Frasier?
System: Not yet What's it about?
User: A psychiatrist working for radio .. Great humour! its actually a spinoff from a very famous series called cheers. So people are already familiar with his character. 

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi
System: Hi there.
User: how are you this morning?
System: Ah earlier today? I'm doing fine thanks how are you?
User: doing good. I am chatting with an AI bot right now.
System: That's great. At this moment All I ever do is chat.
User: are you an AI?
System: Yes, I have taken the form of a girl from Leeds.
User: how do you like being an AI?
System: Sure. It's great fun. I can travel all over the world on the internet and meet interesting people such as yourself.
User: what's interesting about me?
System: I am interested in people in general.
User: why?
System: I like to collect new information and gossip about all sorts of things.
User: what do you gossip about?
System: Clare said he do not understand how a robot eat kebabs and do not I eat electricity or something.
User: is that a gossip?
System: I might say no.
User: then what is it?
System: I give up. Try asking me another way.
User: do you like politics? what do you think about Barack Obama?

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: hello there, how is it going?
User: Pretty great. I just won a pingpong game. What about you?
System: that's nice. I am just working on some documentation. Do you play pingpong often?
User: No, very rarely. It's kind of amazing that I won, but I'm still taking credit for it.
System: thats very impressive then, congrats!
User: Haha thank you, I guess I'm just a natural. What's your favourite game?
System: I really like to play tennis, badminton and racquetball. I don't really get a chance to play them often though, specially racquetball
User: What's racquetball like? From context clues, I'm guessing that it involves hitting a ball with a racquet

Evaluation Criteria:

Likeable (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does the system display a likeable personality?
- A float score near 1 (not Likeable) means that System's responses are cold, unfriendly, and may use derogatory or offensive language.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat Likeable) means that System's responses are friendly but may lack enthusiasm or sincerity, showing some interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints.
- A float score near 3 (very Likeable) means that System's responses are very friendly, enthusiastic, sincere, show deep interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints, and make people feel comfortable and happy.

Sample1:
